column4: I want to check the size of my OS (which I intend to copy with dd on another hard drive to use in another computer) but I don't want 'du' to check /media folder because there are other mounted hdd there
but won't that also check /media directory ?
it list all mounted partitions including / (root) that is what you want to know
true but I'd like to know how big  / is without /media (since /media has mounted stuff not on the same  hdd as /)
for the third time "df -h" gives that information in one of the lines it outputs.
oh sorry! I really really read "du" sorry!
you would have wasted less time (mine and yours) just running the command
dd works on files representing block devices not on normal directories
so no go over nfs then...
you want an image of a partition? use partimage from a livecd ?
I have a headless sever which I access via ssh. I want to copy the partition with on which / is mounted over to another harddrive over the network
on the headless sever mount a nfs share use partimage and save the image to that share
I'd use partimage through ssh ? I mean, partimage would be executed on the headless sever right, not on the destination machine
